name: outbuy
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to spend more money on something than someone else: The company has such large cash reserves that it thinks it can always outbuy any competitors. The TV channel found that they had been outbought for the rights to the show.
More examplesFewer examplesThey are an incredibly rich club and can always outbuy any rivals to acquire the players that they want.I thought I had chosen a really nice bottle of wine, but it was clear my partner had out-bought me when she produced a crate of champagne. The rival candidate has massively outbought her when it comes to paid advertising.
